Key Match Events: David Fry came off the bench to hit a two-run home run in the seventh, giving the lead back to the Guardians.
Fry added an RBI on a squeeze play two innings later, cementing his status as the MVP of the night.
Guardians closer Emmanuel Clase was asked to complete a five-out save and gave up a run in the ninth, but closed the door on Matt Vierling and the Tigers.
Gerrit Cole dominated with a seven-inning start for the Yankees.
Pre-Game Insights: The Tigers lost Game 4, but they automatically earn the edge for Game 5 because Tarik Skubal is on full rest and ready to go in the biggest game of his life.
It's unclear what Cleveland will do to counter him -- Matthew Boyd is the likely starter -- but either way, the Guardians will be underdogs against one of the best in the game.
The Yankees are the top seed in the AL and are playing clean, intelligent baseball.
Post-Match Reflections: The game was tied 1-1 and 2-2 before Detroit took its only lead in the sixth on an RBI hit by pinch hitter Wenceel Perez.
The drama continued through the later innings as Guardians closer Emmanuel Clase was asked to complete a five-out save.
The New York Yankees closed out the Kansas City Royals with the same excellent brand of baseball they exhibited throughout their ALDS matchup.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cleveland Guardians staved off elimination at the hands of the surging Detroit Tigers with a 5-4 win.
The New York Yankees celebrated an ALCS berth after knocking off the Kansas City Royals.
The best game of the series provided highlight reel moments for both teams.
Others: The winner of Cleveland and Detroit's ALDS Game 5 on Saturday will face the Yankees in the ALCS.
